<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This is an important base class in LLVM. It provides the common facilities</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// of all constant values in an LLVM program. A constant is a value that is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00027" /><CodeLine lineNumber="27"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// immutable at runtime. Functions are constants because their address is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00028" /><CodeLine lineNumber="28"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// immutable. Same with global variables.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00029" /><CodeLine lineNumber="29"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00030" /><CodeLine lineNumber="30"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// All constants share the capabilities provided in this class. All constants</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00031" /><CodeLine lineNumber="31"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// can have a null value. They can have an operand list. Constants can be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00032" /><CodeLine lineNumber="32"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// simple (integer and floating point values), complex (arrays and structures),</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00033" /><CodeLine lineNumber="33"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// or expression based (computations yielding a constant value composed of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00034" /><CodeLine lineNumber="34"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// only certain operators and other constant values).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00035" /><CodeLine lineNumber="35"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00036" /><CodeLine lineNumber="36"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Note that Constants are immutable (once created they never change)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00037" /><CodeLine lineNumber="37"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and are fully shared by structural equivalence.  This means that two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// structurally equivalent constants will always have the same address.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Constants are created on demand as needed and never deleted: thus clients</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// don&#39;t have to worry about the lifetime of the objects.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// LLVM Constant Representation</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">class </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a6659b3192e82624cd45d835e9178f8f7">Constant</a> : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">public</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user/#a282fa3e9586425313e0a954c18deee15">User</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">protected</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a6659b3192e82624cd45d835e9178f8f7"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a6659b3192e82624cd45d835e9178f8f7">Constant</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/type">Type</a> &#42;ty, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value/#af6d11b38374c4f9e6ba3a6407da2dee0">ValueTy</a> vty, <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/user/allocinfo">AllocInfo</a> <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/user/allocinfo">AllocInfo</a>)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="176"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00177" /><CodeLine lineNumber="177"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// This method is a special form of User::replaceUsesOfWith</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00178" /><CodeLine lineNumber="178"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// (which does not work on constants) that does work</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="179"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// on constants.  Basically this method goes through the trouble of building</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00180" /><CodeLine lineNumber="180"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// a new constant that is equivalent to the current one, with all uses of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00181" /><CodeLine lineNumber="181"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// From replaced with uses of To.  After this construction is completed, all</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00182" /><CodeLine lineNumber="182"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// of the users of &#39;this&#39; are replaced to use the new constant, and then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00183" /><CodeLine lineNumber="183"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// &#39;this&#39; is deleted.  In general, you should not call this method, instead,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00184" /><CodeLine lineNumber="184"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// use Value::replaceAllUsesWith, which automatically dispatches to this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00185" /><CodeLine lineNumber="185"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// method as needed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  ///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#afb784171b976ddd992e3f27ac36a894d">handleOperandChange</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a> &#42;);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Merges undefs of a Constant with another Constant, along with the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Return true if a constant is ConstantData or a ConstantAggregate or</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant/#a5a4d3145c046afe97789b9739a200971">isManifestConstant</a>() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">private</span><span class="doxyHighlight">:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">enum</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> PossibleRelocationsTy &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00243" /><CodeLine lineNumber="243"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This constant requires no relocations. That is, it holds simple</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00244" /><CodeLine lineNumber="244"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// constants (like integrals).</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00245" /><CodeLine lineNumber="245"><span class="doxyHighlight">    NoRelocation = 0,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00246" /><CodeLine lineNumber="246"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00247" /><CodeLine lineNumber="247"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This constant holds static relocations that can be resolved by the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00248" /><CodeLine lineNumber="248"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// static linker.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00249" /><CodeLine lineNumber="249"><span class="doxyHighlight">    LocalRelocation = 1,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00250" /><CodeLine lineNumber="250"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00251" /><CodeLine lineNumber="251"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// This constant holds dynamic relocations that the dynamic linker will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00252" /><CodeLine lineNumber="252"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">    /// need to resolve.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00253" /><CodeLine lineNumber="253"><span class="doxyHighlight">    GlobalRelocation = 2,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00254" /><CodeLine lineNumber="254"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="255"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="256"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">  /// Determine what potential relocations may be needed by this constant.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="257"><span class="doxyHighlight">  PossibleRelocationsTy getRelocationInfo() </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="258"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="259"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> hasNLiveUses(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>) </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="260"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// end namespace llvm</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"><span class="doxyHighlightPreprocessor">#endif </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// LLVM&#95;IR&#95;CONSTANT&#95;H</span></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
